title: Giorgos Merkis
text:
Giorgos Merkis (, born 30 July 1984) is a retired <a href="Cyprus">Cypriot</a> professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who played as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Centre-back">centre back</a> for <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a> club <a href="APOEL%20FC">APOEL</a> and the <a href="Cyprus%20national%20football%20team">Cyprus national team</a>.
Career.
Apollon Limassol.
Merkis is a product of <a href="Apollon%20Limassol">Apollon Limassol</a> academies, making his first team debut during <a href="2001%E2%80%9302%20Cypriot%20First%20Division">2001–02 season</a> at the age of 17. He spent the vast majority of his career with Apollon, where he won one <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">championship</a>, two <a href="Cypriot%20Cup">cups</a> and one <a href="Cypriot%20Super%20Cup">super cup</a>. After fifteen years at the club, his contract was mutually terminated on 12 January 2016.
APOEL.
On 12 January 2016, Merkis signed an 18-month contract with fellow <a href="Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a> club <a href="APOEL%20FC">APOEL</a>. He made his official debut on 17 January 2016, coming on as a 69th-minute substitute in APOEL's 3–0 home win against <a href="Enosis%20Neon%20Paralimni%20FC">Enosis Neon Paralimni</a> for the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a>. He scored his first goal for APOEL against his former team <a href="Apollon%20Limassol">Apollon Limassol</a> on 2 April 2016, netting a late equalizer in his team's 2–2 home draw for the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Cypriot%20First%20Division%23Championship%20round">Cypriot First Division</a> Championship play-offs. A few months after joining APOEL, he was crowned champion as his team won the <a href="2015%E2%80%9316%20Cypriot%20First%20Division">Cypriot First Division</a> title for a fourth consecutive time.
On 2 March 2017, Merkis signed a two-year contract extension with APOEL, running until 31 May 2019.
International career.
Merkis made his international debut with <a href="Cyprus%20national%20football%20team">Cyprus National Team</a> on 1 March 2006, in friendly match against <a href="Armenia%20national%20football%20team">Armenia</a> at <a href="Tsirion%20Stadium">Tsirion Stadium</a>, coming on as a 79th-minute substitute in <a href="Cyprus%20national%20football%20team">Cyprus'</a> 2–0 win. He scored his first goal on 16 November 2014, netting the opening goal in <a href="Cyprus%20national%20football%20team">Cyprus'</a> 5–0 home victory against <a href="Andorra%20national%20football%20team">Andorra</a> for the <a href="UEFA%20Euro%202016%20qualifying">UEFA Euro 2016 qualifiers</a>.
